statusDescriptions.working: All inverters in the plant are operating normally.
statusDescriptions.waiting: No inverter alarms or offline status, but at least one inverter is in a waiting state.

statusDescriptions.error: At least one inverter in the plant is issuing an alarm.

operationMayTake: The operation may take a little longer depending on the number of plants being fetched. Please be patient.
dayIncomeTooltip: Income generated in the past 24 hours from your solar installation
performanceRatioTooltip: Actual vs theoretical maximum energy generation efficiency
currentMonthEarnings: Your earnings for the current month
currentPowerTooltip: Current power generated by the system
monthlyGenerationValueTooltip: Total energy produced in current month
statusTooltip: Current operational status of the plant
locationTooltip: Physical location of the solar installation
installationDateTooltip: Date when the system was installed
batteryIndicatorTooltip: This shows the battery state of charge (SOC) in percentage.
noDataForRange: Sorry, no data available for the selected range.

tooltips.pvgeneration: Energy generated by your solar panels in real-time.
tooltips.autoconsumo: Energy consumed directly from your solar panels.
tooltips.feedin: Excess energy sent back to the grid.
tooltips.consumo: Total energy consumed by your home.
tooltips.day: Shows data for the last 24 hours.
tooltips.week: Shows data for the past 7 days.
tooltips.month: Shows data for the past 30 days.
tooltips.year: Shows data for the last 12 months.
tooltips.producción solar: The total energy generated by the solar panels.
tooltips.exportación: Energy exported to the grid from your system.
tooltips.importación: Energy imported from the grid to your system.

energyTodayTooltip: The total energy generated by the solar system today.
energyThisMonthTooltip: The total energy generated by the solar system this month.
energyTotalTooltip: The total energy generated by the solar system since installation.
totalMoneyTooltip: Total revenues generated by the plant.
maxPowerTooltip: The peak power generated by the solar system during its operation.
gasEmissionSavedTooltip: Quantity of CO2 emissions that would have been generated by an equivalent fossil fuel system.
treesPlantedTooltip: Equivalent planting of new trees for reducing CO2 levels.
batteryTooltipContent: Current charge level of your solar plant's storage battery

tooltips.overview: This panel shows the real-time energy flow between solar panels, battery, your home, and the power grid
tooltips.homeConsumption: The total amount of energy your home is currently using, including appliances, lighting, and other devices
tooltips.gridInput: Energy being drawn from the power grid when solar production isn't sufficient to cover consumption
tooltips.batteryStatus: The battery stores excess solar energy for later use when there's no sun
tooltips.solarProduction: The amount of energy your solar panels are currently generating
tooltips.backupGenerator: Auxiliary power system that can provide energy when both solar and grid power are unavailable
tooltips.flowToHome: Energy flowing to power your home appliances and devices
tooltips.flowToGrid: Excess energy being exported to the power grid
tooltips.systemState: Indicates if the system is operating correctly and converting solar energy into usable electricity

acInput.title: AC Input
acInput.tooltip: This is the power coming from the grid into the system. It is used to power the system when solar power is insufficient.

generator.title: Generator
generator.tooltip: The generator provides power when solar energy is unavailable or during times of high demand. This is the backup power source.

battery.title: Battery
battery.tooltip: The battery stores energy produced by solar panels for use when there is no sunlight. It helps provide energy when demand exceeds solar production.

inverter.title: Inverter
inverter.tooltip: The inverter converts DC (direct current) from the solar panels or battery into AC (alternating current) used by home appliances.

solarYield.title: Total Solar Power
solarYield.tooltip: The total amount of power produced by the solar panels. This shows how much energy your solar system is generating.

loads.title: Loads
loads.tooltip: The total power consumption of all connected loads. This shows how much power is being used by your devices.

pvCharger.title: PV Charger
pvCharger.tooltip: The power of the photovoltaic charger, which converts solar energy into DC power to charge the battery.

mppt.title: MPPT
mppt.tooltip: MPPT (Maximum Power Point Tracking) is a technology used to extract the maximum possible power from the solar panels by constantly adjusting the operating point.

noShowSelectedAlerts: Do not show the selected alerts
unsilenceAlertDescSuccess: The selected alerts are no longer muted.
areYouSureCloseAlerts: Are you sure you want to close alerts manually?
closeAlertsWarning: Please note that the system closes alerts automatically when the related issue is resolved. This may take several hours. Are you sure you want to proceed and close it manually anyway?
environmentalBenefitsCalculation: The positive impact of the plant on the environment is calculated by multiplying the system's energy production with CO2 and miles calculated by the average of gasoline passenger vehicle calculation factors provided by the US EPA and local standards.
seeCompleteCalculation: Click here to see complete calculation
